byline.contributor: Samantha Farlow, Alex Vadukul and David Waldstein contributed reporting.

abstract: Major League Baseball follows robust security procedures introduced by Homeland Security Dept; recently, many stadiums have replaced hand-held magnetometer with standing metal detectors in concerted effort to prevent terrorist attacks.
lead_paragraph: Nearly three hours before Masahiro Tanaka threw the first pitch of the Yankees 2015 season, throngs of fans found themselves squeezing through metal detectors erected at every gate of Yankee Stadium.

headline.main: Metal Detectors Become One More Reason to Get to the Ballpark Early
